headline: Duke Energy Plan Includes New Gas-Fired Plants, Nuclear Additions, Delayed Coal Retirements
summary: Duke Energy announced plans to build more natural gas-fired generation capacity and look at nuclear power in order to meet the increased demand for power in its Carolinas service territory. The utility also said it will delay the retirement of some coal-fired facilities as it seeks to increase the supply of electricity for data centers and manufacturing plants.

headline: How Duke Energy's (DUK) Dividend Hike and Modernization Push Are Shaping Its Investment Narrative
summary: Duke Energy recently raised its quarterly dividend and submitted a comprehensive long-term energy modernization plan in response to robust electricity demand growth in the Carolinas. The plan highlights the company's efforts to add nuclear, natural gas, solar, battery storage, and coal resources, while Duke's ongoing community investments further underscore its regional impact. We'll examine how Duke Energy's dividend increase and modernization plan filings could influence its growth...

headline: NextEra Energy Gains From Investment and Renewable Focus
summary: NEE's strong investment plan to strengthen renewable power generation and acquisitions to expand overall operations is likely to continue boosting its performance.

headline: NeOnc Technologies Appoints Dr. David M. Ashley, Director of The Preston Robert Tisch Brain Tumor Center at Duke, to Scientific Advisory Board
summary: CALABASAS, Calif., Oct. 02, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- NeOnc Technologies Holdings, Inc. (NTHI) (“NeOnc” or the “Company”), a multi-Phase 2 clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company pioneering therapies for central nervous system (CNS) cancers, today announced it has appointed Dr. David M. Ashley to its scientific advisory board. Dr. Ashley is the Rory David Deutsch Distinguished Professor of Neuro-Oncology and the Director of The Preston Robert Tisch Brain Tumor Center at Duke University. Amir F.

raw.headline: NeOnc Technologies Appoints Dr. David M. Ashley, Director of The Preston Robert Tisch Brain Tumor Center at Duke, to Scientific Advisory Board
raw.summary: CALABASAS, Calif., Oct. 02, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- NeOnc Technologies Holdings, Inc. (NTHI) (“NeOnc” or the “Company”), a multi-Phase 2 clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company pioneering therapies for central nervous system (CNS) cancers, today announced it has appointed Dr. David M. Ashley to its scientific advisory board. Dr. Ashley is the Rory David Deutsch Distinguished Professor of Neuro-Oncology and the Director of The Preston Robert Tisch Brain Tumor Center at Duke University. Amir F.
